Buoyed by the runaway success of â€œKPop Demon Hunters,â€ â€œHappy Gilmore 2â€ and the second season of â€œWednesday,â€ Netflixâ€™s third-quarter revenue grew 17 percent, with net income increasing by 8 percent, the company said on Tuesday, Oct. 21, 2025. (Ye Fan/The New York Times)

 **â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ Helps Lift Netflix Revenue 17%**   
 Â Â    
 Â    
 Buoyed by the runaway success of â€œKPop Demon Hunters,â€ â€œHappy Gilmore 2â€ and the second season of â€œWednesday,â€ Netflixâ€™s third-quarter revenue grew 17%, with net income increasing 8%, the company said Tuesday.   
 Â    
 The streaming giant said the higher results had come from a mix of subscription growth, advertising and other sales.   
 Â    
 â€œKPop Demon Huntersâ€ â€” a movie produced at Sony Animation but released directly to Netflix at the end of August â€” is now the most-watched film in the streaming companyâ€™s history, with 325 million views. It was also the first Netflix movie to top the box office chart, when it was released for a weekend in August. (It will jump back into theaters over Halloween weekend.)   
 Â    
 On Tuesday, the company announced a deal with Mattel and Hasbro to sell toys, games and role-playing products tied to the movie beginning in 2026.   
 Â    
 Yet its success in theaters has done nothing to change Netflixâ€™s approach to theatrical releases. To Ted Sarandos, a co-CEO, it reinforces it. In a post-earnings conference call, Sarandos said he believed the success of â€œKPop Demon Huntersâ€ could happen only on Netflix because of the â€œubiquity of distribution.â€   
 Â    
 The company said its third-quarter slate had helped push it to a record share of television time in both the United States and Britain. Netflix also highlighted its live bout between Terence Crawford and Canelo Ãlvarez as a breakthrough moment for the global audience, attracting more than 41 million viewers.   
 Â    
 Netflix does not break out revenue from advertising, an increasingly important part of the business but not yet a primary income driver, and it no longer reports subscriber growth. But it said that it had its best quarter and that it was on track to double sales in 2025.   
 Â    
 Its overall operating margin, which was expected to come in at 31%, dropped to 28%. The company said the lower result was due to a dispute with Brazilian tax authorities, and would have otherwise beat the expectations.   
 Â    
 Revenue rose to $11.5 billion with net income totaling $2.5 billion, up from $2.36 billion in the third quarter of 2024. Netflix also forecast increased revenue for the fourth quarter but lower operating margin and net income.   
 Â    
 Â
